messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-06 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-06/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 389 views       | -0.3%        | -14.5%        
Products Page      | 1,068 views     | +39.6%       | -7.1%         
Signup Page        | 26 views        | -13.3%       | -67.9%        
Checkout Page      | 34 views        | -2.9%        | -52.1%        
Successful Orders  | 5 orders        | -50.0%       | -61.5%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 6, 2025, the VMS business experienced concerning performance with only 5 successful orders (-5 day-over-day, -8 week-over-week), representing the lowest conversion in the analyzed period. Despite products page views recovering with a strong +303 daily increase to 1,068 views, the funnel shows significant deterioration at later stages, with signup and checkout page views both declining week-over-week by -55 and -37 respectively. *Key Insights:*
• Conversion funnel shows severe drop-off at final stages: while products page views increased 40% day-over-day, successful orders fell to just 5 units, indicating a critical conversion problem between product interest and purchase completion
• Weekly trends reveal concerning momentum loss: landing page views (-66), signup page views (-55), and checkout views (-37) all declined compared to the same day last week, suggesting weakening customer acquisition
• The conversion rate from checkout to orders appears severely impacted: 34 checkout page views resulted in only 5 orders (14.7% conversion), compared to stronger historical performance earlier in the period
• Products page engagement remains relatively strong at 1,068 views with positive week-over-week performance (-82 but recovering from recent lows), indicating maintained product interest despite poor conversion
• Signup funnel shows critical weakness with only 26 views (-4 daily, -55 weekly), representing the lowest signup interest in the analyzed timeframe and creating a bottleneck for future conversions

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-04 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-04/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 478 views       | -15.5%       | +28.5%        
Products Page      | 812 views       | -20.5%       | +33.6%        
Signup Page        | 38 views        | +18.8%       | -46.5%        
Checkout Page      | 40 views        | +8.1%        | -23.1%        
Successful Orders  | 14 orders       | +75.0%       | +55.6%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On 2025-12-04, the VMS business showed mixed performance with 14 successful orders (up 6 from previous day, +5 week-over-week), indicating steady conversion despite funnel challenges. The conversion rate from landing page views to orders improved to 2.93%, though earlier funnel stages experienced significant declines with products page views dropping 210 day-over-day and landing page views down 88 from the previous day. *Key Insights:*
• Order conversion strength: Despite funnel deterioration, successful orders increased 75% week-over-week (14 vs 8) and doubled day-over-day (+6), demonstrating improved conversion efficiency at 2.93% from landing to orders
• Funnel compression pattern: Significant drops in early funnel stages (landing views -18% WoW, products views -21% WoW) but stronger performance in later stages (orders +75% WoW) suggests better quality traffic and improved conversion optimization
• Mid-funnel weakness: Signup page views declined sharply (-46% WoW, -33 absolute) and checkout views dropped 30% WoW, indicating potential friction in the signup-to-checkout transition that needs addressing
• Weekly momentum building: The +106 week-over-week increase in landing page views and +204 in products page views shows positive weekly trends, though day-over-day declines suggest daily volatility in traffic acquisition
• Conversion rate optimization success: Overall funnel conversion improved significantly with orders-to-checkout ratio reaching 35% (14/40) compared to much lower historical ratios, indicating successful checkout process improvements

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-03 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-03/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 566 views       | -2.4%        | +15.0%        
Products Page      | 1,022 views     | -2.8%        | -8.7%         
Signup Page        | 32 views        | -41.8%       | -79.9%        
Checkout Page      | 37 views        | -46.4%       | -70.9%        
Successful Orders  | 8 orders        | -42.9%       | -65.2%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 3rd, 2025, VMS business metrics showed mixed performance with 566 landing page views (+74 week-over-week) but concerning drops in conversion funnel completion, resulting in only 8 successful orders (-6 from previous day, -15 week-over-week). While top-of-funnel traffic remained relatively stable, significant declines in signup page views (-127 week-over-week) and checkout completions (-90 week-over-week) indicate conversion optimization issues that require immediate attention. *Key Insights:*
• Conversion funnel shows severe bottleneck at signup stage with only 32 signup page views (5.6% of landing page traffic) compared to 159 the previous week, representing a 79.9% week-over-week decline
• Checkout-to-order conversion rate dropped to 21.6% (8 orders from 37 checkout views) versus 26.1% the previous week, suggesting payment or final step friction
• Landing page traffic maintained momentum with +74 week-over-week growth (+13.1%), but products page views declined -97 week-over-week (-8.7%), indicating poor landing-to-products conversion
• Weekly trend analysis reveals consistent underperformance across all conversion stages compared to the previous Tuesday, with successful orders down 65% week-over-week
• Critical business concern: Despite stable top-funnel traffic, the 8 successful orders on December 3rd represents the lowest Tuesday performance in the dataset and suggests systematic conversion issues requiring immediate investigation

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-02 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-02/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 578 views       | -17.1%       | +0.9%         
Products Page      | 1,051 views     | -28.6%       | -5.8%         
Signup Page        | 55 views        | -34.5%       | -34.5%        
Checkout Page      | 69 views        | -26.6%       | +27.8%        
Successful Orders  | 14 orders       | -36.4%       | +133.3%       
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 2nd, VMS business performance showed mixed signals with 14 successful orders (-8 from previous day but +8 vs. previous week), indicating weekly growth despite daily volatility. The conversion funnel experienced significant drops at the top (landing page views down -119 day-over-day) and middle stages, but maintained relatively stable order conversion rates around 1.3%. Weekly trends remain positive with most metrics showing growth compared to November 25th, suggesting underlying business momentum despite short-term fluctuations. *Key Insights:*
• Order volume of 14 on Dec 2nd represents +57% weekly growth (vs 8 orders on Nov 25th), demonstrating strong week-over-week momentum despite the -36% daily decline from Dec 1st's peak of 22 orders
• Conversion funnel shows concerning top-funnel weakness with landing page views dropping -17% day-over-day to 578, while products page views declined -29% to 1,051, indicating potential traffic acquisition or retention issues
• Mid-funnel conversion from products to signup remained weak at 5.2% (55/1,051), significantly lower than the 7.5% rate seen on peak days, suggesting product page optimization opportunities
• Checkout-to-order conversion rate of 20.3% (14/69) on Dec 2nd remains healthy and above the period average of ~15%, indicating strong purchase intent among users who reach checkout
• Weekly comparison reveals positive trends across all metrics: landing views +0.9%, products views -5.8%, signups -34%, checkouts +21%, and orders +75%, with the order growth being the most critical business indicator

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-01 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-01/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 697 views       | +42.5%       | +16.4%        
Products Page      | 1,472 views     | +26.1%       | +6.9%         
Signup Page        | 84 views        | 0.0%         | +25.4%        
Checkout Page      | 94 views        | +19.0%       | +64.9%        
Successful Orders  | 22 orders       | +46.7%       | +37.5%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 1st, 2025, the VMS business showed strong performance with 22 successful orders (+7 from previous day, +6 vs. previous week), driven by significant improvements in top-of-funnel traffic with landing page views reaching 697 (+208 day-over-day, +98 weekly). The conversion funnel demonstrated healthy momentum across all stages, with checkout completions at 94 users and sustained engagement throughout the customer journey. *Key Insights:*
• Strong order performance on target date with 22 successful orders, representing the second-highest daily total in the 15-day period and showing positive momentum with +32% day-over-day growth and +38% week-over-week growth
• Exceptional landing page traffic surge to 697 views (+42% daily, +16% weekly), indicating successful marketing efforts or campaign effectiveness that drove significant top-of-funnel improvement
• Healthy conversion funnel maintenance with products page views at 1,472 (+26% daily) and checkout page views at 94 (+19% daily, +65% weekly), showing sustained user engagement through the purchase journey
• Week-over-week trends show consistent improvement across most funnel stages, with particularly strong performance in checkout conversions (+37 weekly) and order completions (+6 weekly), suggesting effective optimization of the purchase process
• The order conversion rate from checkout views improved to 23% (22 orders from 94 checkout views), indicating strong closing effectiveness and reduced drop-off at the final purchase stage

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-11-30 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-11-30/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 489 views       | +7.5%        | -10.9%        
Products Page      | 1,167 views     | +1.7%        | -37.9%        
Signup Page        | 84 views        | +3.7%        | +100.0%       
Checkout Page      | 79 views        | +11.3%       | +25.4%        
Successful Orders  | 15 orders       | +15.4%       | +50.0%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On November 30th, the VMS business showed mixed performance with 15 successful orders (up 2 from the previous day but maintaining consistent levels), while the conversion funnel displayed concerning inefficiencies with only 1.3% of landing page visitors converting to orders. The funnel shows significant drop-offs particularly between products page views (1,167) and signup page views (84), indicating potential optimization opportunities in the user experience flow. *Key Insights:*
• Conversion funnel performance remains suboptimal with a 1.3% overall conversion rate (15 orders from 1,167 products page views), highlighting significant leakage between products viewing and signup completion
• Weekly comparison shows positive momentum with successful orders up 5 from the previous Saturday, while checkout page views increased by 16, indicating improved purchase intent conversion
• Landing page performance declined 12% week-over-week (-60 visitors), but products page engagement dropped more dramatically by 38% (-713 views), suggesting potential issues with landing page conversion or external traffic sources
• The signup-to-checkout conversion rate improved to 94% (79 checkout views from 84 signup views), demonstrating strong purchase intent once users commit to the signup process
• Products page views significantly outpaced landing page views (1,167 vs 489), indicating strong direct traffic or bookmark behavior, but the 7% signup conversion rate from products views remains a critical bottleneck
